N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 108.7 - Other instruction

State Regulations
(a) Instruction concerning the flag as a symbol of American life should not be
limited to the observance of Flag Day. Before leaving the elementary school, each child should come to think of himself as a "maker of the flag" and each
pupil who passes through the secondary school should be guided in sober thought
as to the meaning of "liberty and justice for all."
(b) In addition to the provisions of
subdivision (a) of this section, schools must provide specific instruction
regarding respect for the flag of the United States of America, its display and
use, to include as a minimum, instruction regarding the provisions of sections
170 through 177 of title 36 of the United States Code. Notes
